name: Tilapia in Soy Ginger
description: This Tilapia in Soy Ginger recipe is a perfect match for those looking for a high-protein, low-carb, and low-sugar option. Embrace a healthier lifestyle with this mouthwatering dish that combines the delicate flavors of fresh tilapia, ginger, and soy, beautifully accented with moringa leaves and a hint of calamansi and black pepper. Ideal for anyone looking to enjoy healthy recipes without sacrificing flavor!

recipeInstructions.text: Prepare the ingredients: Peel and mince the ginger root. Squeeze the calamansi to get fresh juice. Rinse the tilapia under cold water and pat dry.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 1

recipeInstructions.text: Marinate the tilapia in a mixture of soy sauce, calamansi juice, minced ginger, and black pepper for at least 30 minutes in the refrigerator.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 2

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat a non-stick pan over medium heat and gently place the marinated tilapia in it, cooking for 4 minutes on each side or until the fish is cooked through and golden brown.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 3

recipeInstructions.text: In the last minute of cooking, sprinkle the moringa leaves over the tilapia to lightly wilt them.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 4

recipeInstructions.text: Serve the tilapia hot, garnished with additional calamansi slices or moringa leaves if desired.
recipeInstructions.name: Step 5
